IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROVIDE HOUSING AND SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY & HANDICAPPED
IRS990.MissionDescription: GIVENS ESTATES UNITED METHODIST RETIREMENT COMMUNITY IS A CHRISTIAN, ECUMENICAL, NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION COMMITTED TO PROVIDING THE FULL CONTINUUM OF QUALITY CARE AND SERVICES TO SENIORS WITHIN ITS COMMUNITY AND TO PROVIDING OUTREACH MINISTRIES IN THE LARGER COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Description: GIVENS ESTATES, INC. IS A CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY LOCATED IN ASHEVILLE, NORTH CAROLINA. THE COMMUNITY INCLUDES 400 INDEPENDENT LIVING RESIDENCES, 47 ASSISTED LIVING RESIDENCES, AND 84 HEALTH CARE BEDS (INCLUDING 58 MEDICARE/MEDICAID CERTIFIED BEDS). INTERNAL BENEVOLENCE SUPPORTING RESIDENTS WITH LIMITED RESOURCES AMOUNTED TO $711,586 IN 2010. THROUGH OUTREACH MINISTRIES GIVENS ESTATES EXTENDS ITS MINISTRY INTO THE GREATER WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA REGION BY DELIBERATELY SEEKING WAYS TO HELP THOSE WHO ARE LESS FORTUNATE INCLUDING MEDICATION ASSISTANCE FOR THOSE WHO ARE UNINSURED, COMMUNITY MEAL SITES, MEDICAL LOAN CLOSETS, ETC.

Form990PartVIISectionA.NamePerson: REVEREND DR J ALEXANDER WARD JR
Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: DIRECTOR

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF HOW ORGANIZATION REPORTS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE CONSERVATION EASEMENTS ARE RECORDED AS ASSETS IN THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION REPORTS THE ASSOCIATED EXPENSES AS SUCH IN THE FINANCIALS. THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT RECOGNIZE REVENUE ASSOCIATED WITH THE CONSERVATION EASEMENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE COMPANY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE; ACCORDINGLY, THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS DO NOT REFLECT A PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES. THE COMPANY HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS OR OBLIGATIONS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2010. FISCAL YEARS ENDED ON OR AFTER DECEMBER 31, 2007 REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL AND STATE TAX AUTHORITIES.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: SUPPLEMENTAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDING RESIDENTS WITH CREDITS ON THEIR ACCOUNT FOR MONTHLY FEES, FOOD COSTS AND HEALTHCARE RELATED COSTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.MethodOfValuation: AMOUNT PAID TO THIRD PARTY VENDOR FOR ASSISTANCE
Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: ASSISTANCE FOR CHOLESTEROL SCREENING, MEDICATION, AND MISCELLANEOUS FINANCIAL NEEDS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS IN THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS: SOCIAL WORKERS IDENTIFY RESIDENTS WITH FINANCIAL OR OTHER NEEDS AND REQUEST ASSISTANCE. THESE REQUESTS ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGERS TO ENSURE THAT THE INDIVIDUALS SELECTED MEET THE REQUIREMENTS APPROVED BY GIVENS ESTATES AND LIFEMINISTRIES FOR ASSISTANCE.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: OFFICERS RECEIVE A BONUS AT YEAR END. JOB PERFORMANCE FACTORS SUCH AS RESIDENT SATISFACTION, MEETING BUDGET, DEPARTMENT PERFORMACE HELP DETERMINE BONUS AMOUNT. BONUSES RECEIVED WERE AS FOLLOWS: KENNITH PARTIN - $25,000; ALLEN SQUIRES - $25,000; JOHN COWAN - $25,000

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: CAMPUS EXPANSION, CONSTRUCTION OF WELLNESS CENTER AND REF. OF HC FACILITIES

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ROBERT E. SHEPHERD AND PEGGY C. MELVILLE - BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWED THE FORM 990 FIRST AND ISSUED A RECOMMENDATION TO THE BOARD THAT THEY REVIEW THE 990 AND APPROVE FOR IT TO BE FILED. ALL BOARD MEMBERS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE 990 PRIOR TO THE NEXT BOARD MEETING AND MADE A MOTION THAT THEY HAVE REVIEWED THE 990 AND TOOK THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE TO FILE AS PRESENTED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD IS REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ANNUALLY. WHEN AN INDIVIDUAL BECOMES AWARE OF A NEW CONFLICT, HE OR SHE MUST FILL OUT ANOTHER CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM. IF A BOARD MEMBER DOES HAVE A CONFLICT, HE OR SHE SHOULD ACKNOWLEDGE THE CONFLICT AND EXCUSE THEMSELVES FROM DISCUSSING OR VOTING ON AN ISSUE WHERE THERE IS A CONFLICT. IF ANYONE BECOMES AWARE OF A BOARD MEMBER NOT ACKNOWLEDGING A CONFLICT, WE MAKE THE BOARD CHAIRPERSON AWARE OF THE ISSUE AND ACT ACCORDINGLY.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GIVENS ESTATES, INC. HAS DEVELOPED AN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION POLICY THAT PROVIDES A BOARD-BASED FOUNDATION FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FAIR, REASONABLE, AND COMPETITIVE COMPENSATION PACKAGE FOR EXECUTIVE LEADERSHIP. THE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS ARE DETERMINED ANNUALLY TO BE COMMENSURATE WITH THE PERFORMANCE EVALUATION BY BOARD CHAIR, VICE CHAIR AND SECRETARY THEN RECOMMENDED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, WHICH IN TURN WILL RECOMMEND THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION TO THE FULL BOARD FOR APPROVAL. THE PROCESS ALSO UTILIZES MARKET-RATE AND PERFORMANCE BASED COMPARATIVE DATA TO HELP DETERMINE A REASONABLE COMPENSATION PACKAGE. THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS ARE THEN DISCUSSED WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDITORS TO ENSURE REASONABLENESS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 1023, FORM 990, AND FORM 990-T ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE. THE FORM 990 CAN ALSO BE ACCESSED THROUGH GUIDESTAR.ORG, A NON-PROFIT WEBSITE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE.
